ALWAYS use Little Snitch to block access to Elgato with any version of EyeTV. Don't even let it connect to services.elgato.com for the program guide. It WILL report your SN and invalidate it. Nothing you do will fix the problem since EyeTV puts an invisible file somewhere on your drive that says you're using a pirated version. You'll have to wait for the next version and a new SN.

Add this to your /etc/hosts:
127.0.0.1	services.eyetv.com

No need to use little snitch anymore!

Most people don't know how to edit their hosts file. Besides, you don't know what servers elgato will use in the future. Without Little Snitch, you won't know what other connections it's trying. In fact, they already use both services.elgato.com and updates.elgato.com. I only noted services because that's the one that people might allow to connect to get the free one-year subscription to the TV Guide EPG, but both updates and services checks your SN. Block that and use the over the air ATSC guide.
